author: catsper
title: Infinity Financial Operating System
description: Transações simples do dia-a-dia no espaço desafiador são difíceis e tornam pouco atraente o envio/recepção de pagamentos para indivíduos e empresas.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge brief is written very broadly and unclear. From my opinion, the proposal does address the challenge as the solution proposed will tie in with business and promote cross-collaboration between the fiat world and blockchain.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provided a short team bio, I would like to see links to LInkedIn or similar to verify experience and qualifications. The proposal lays out a good vision but the path to success is unclear for me, I would like the team to expand on the go-to market strategy and customer acquisition plan.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a high level roadmap and line item budget. I would like the team to recreate a detailed roadmap with milestones that are connected to the KPIs and budget, in this way the team can track performance vs. expenditure over time. Furthermore, I would like to see the team add measurable goals to the KPIs identified – create/sign up/ X number by Y date –, tie in with 8 DEX's by week 12, etc. As the proposal stands at the moment it might be challenging to audit.
f6_assessments.reply:
Feasibility:
Accepted and agree regarding team bio, I will link verifiable profiles for my own and the team bio in the future. A website is still getting built.

re path the success: the success lies in the adoption of such a product. However, there can not be adoption without a base version 1 product to begin with. Thus this proposal only focused on what was achievable in the first 3 to 6 months, for which funding form catalyst 7 and 8 would be approached. Once the team has a product (and the suggested one for first use was BTS), the strategy for adoption and acquisition would be addressed with a clearer idea. Regardless, there was some insight as to offering this product to stake pools as the first step in integration to the Cardano ecosystem.

Auditability: I agree that there is a need for this level of detail regarding KPI and measurable goals in the medium to long term. However the goal setting and KPI's that were addressed in this proposal focused on the core development of the product. As this project is at its start. Therefore measurable goals for the development of the product/project could be reviewed before testnet/mainnet deployment, for which (i agree) signups and tie-in with DEX's would be addressed.

f6_assessments.q0: I am coming at this from a strategy and business angle. I think the problem statement is very cool and it hits on what defi wants to do; seamless and secure payments from anyone to anywhere.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project is potentially very large and there is only one team member mentioned. There has been a lot of effort put into the proposal but I wonder if a team can be formed around the idea. Maybe a team should be in place first.   

Is the money requested enough to execute on this? It would be great if there was a breakdown of funds to see how the proposer has thought about this.
f6_assessments.q2: The amount being asked for is reasonable and within the limits of the challenge. The plan is broken up into time stages so that the project could be audited.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal suggests a financial operating system focussed on point of sale transactions that will make it easy for two parties to transact with each other whilst also providing assurances towards AML and KYC requirements. Currently it is difficult for the average user to use cryptocurrency in day to day life when transacting and more recently it is becoming increasingly clear of the importance of KYC and AML in DeFi solutions in ensuring regulatory compliances are met when transacting in crypto. Due to the importance of this market and what has been defined this proposal has a high chance for impact if executed well and integrated into existing services. 

The white paper provided helps to address some key use cases along with a good overview of the systems functionality broken down into different components. It would have been good to see some existing partnerships or ideas on how to fulfil the vision of this proposal to help gage whether the impact could be very high for the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal provides some overview information on the proposer stating - 'SPO, Smart Contract & Defi developer, PhD Mathematical Physics, Computer Scientist, Blockchain researcher'. No supporting sources such as a LinkedIn profile are provided to verify their professional background or involvement in Cardano. No open source code or previous implemented projects are provided that would give confidence towards whether this proposal is feasible.

The white paper is well articulated which helps provide some evidence that the proposer fully understands the problem and the path to creating a suitable solution. Along with this the proposer has broken down the core parts of the development showcasing the steps towards an implementation. 

The proposer mentions hiring two full time backend developers to help complete the project. The budget requested is $24,000 which makes this look difficult to achieve without further explanation on how it will be arranged. For example is the intention to have short contracts to work on the proposal? Have you already sourced any developers and if not what is your approach? This is a massive risk to the feasibility without a solid plan - developers are hard to source.

The proposer appears to have a good grasp of the problem and a potential solution which could have a great impact in the community if delivered to a high standard. However it is hard to give a better rating than what has been given due to the lack of clarity on the team, evidence of the competency of that team, practicalities of paying for that team within the budget and any previous work examples that would help drive confidence that this proposal is feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: A break down of the project components is given along with an outline towards the schedule of implementation. It would be good to see more KPIs focussed on what would be meaningful usage of this proposed solution. Any potential partners that could be initial users would also be useful to understand how the proposal could be adopted. Finally it would be useful to understand whether this protocol will be open source from the start or what plans are made to provide examples and education to the community on the implementation suggested.
f6_assessments.reply:
Feasibility:
Accepted and noted for next time regarding verifiable links for team/my bio i will provide this for next time. A website is currently in development. Section 8 of the white paper suggest a verifiable stake pool that the project runs, this should shows involvement in the Cardano ecosystem:
"the Infinity project will be deployed on the voter selected stake
pools as well as the already existing official stake pool for the Infinity project:
Infinity stake pool ticker: INFTY"

regarding the budget request to hire two full time devs. Obviously the project would want developers long term, however it was suggested (by a question/comment) that my funding request should focus on that is achievable in this funding round. Therefore i only requested funds for two devs for 12 weeks. I already have one developer on standby and a second would either be myself or another. This should be (with respect to the development timeline, enough time to demonstrate core features of the Infinity product. Catalyst 8 would then be approached if the project cannot self fund. 

For future Catalyst proposals i will write attached/additional information of a product development timeline instead of trying  to squeeze it in to the main proposal brief. KPIs will then be attached to this development/project timeline. 

The protocol at this stage was not meant to be open source, however a specification and peer review process was suggested possibly before deployment (definitely a code audit), at this stage a general protocol and/or CIP, or framework could be open sourced.

solution: Um Sistema Operacional Financeiro (FOS) chamado Infinity, como infra-estrutura de camada 1,5, que utiliza escalas de camada 2 e tecnologias de camada 1 de núcleo
experience: SPO, desenvolvedor Smart Contract & Defi, PhD em Física Matemática, cientista da computação, pesquisador da Blockchain
